alert.note: Alert for Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 10 at 9:57PM CDT until April 12 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 004, 016, AND 081... Humidity is now rising and winds have calmed. The RFW will be allowed to expire. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM CDT MONDAY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 004, 016, AND 081... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 004, 016, AND 081... * Affected Area...In Kansas...Fire Weather Zone 004 Norton and Fire Weather Zone 016 Graham. In Nebraska...Fire Weather Zone 081 Red Willow. * Timing...On Monday is valid fromnoon CDT through 8 PM CDT. On Tuesday the watch is valid from noon CDT through 8 PM CDT. * Winds...South 15 to 25 mph with higher gusts Monday, southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph Tuesday. * Relative Humidity...As low as 15 percent Monday and 13 percent Tuesday. * Temperatures...In the middle 60s Monday, middle 80s Tuesday. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised. An abrupt wind shift to the northwest is expected late Tuesday afternoon as a cold front moves through.
info.instruction: Avoid creating sparks. Take notice of any local burn bans.
